tabitems.js

Summary
tabitems.js
TabItemAn Item that represents a tab.
Functions
forceCanvasSizeRepaints the thumbnail with the given resolution, and forces it to stay that resolution until unforceCanvasSize is called.
unforceCanvasSizeStops holding the thumbnail resolution; allows it to shift to the size of thumbnail on screen.
showCachedDataShows the cached data i.e.
hideCachedDataHides the cached data i.e.
getStorageDataGet data to be used for persistent storage of this object.
saveStore persistent for this object.
setBoundsMoves this item to the specified location and size.
getBoundsWithTitleReturns a Rect for the group’s bounds, including the title
inStackReturns true if this item is in a stacked group.
setZSets the z-index for this item.
closeCloses this item (actually closes the tab associated with it, which automatically closes the item.
addClassAdds the specified CSS class to this item’s container DOM element.
removeClassRemoves the specified CSS class from this item’s container DOM element.
setResizableIf value is true, makes this item resizable, otherwise non-resizable.
makeActiveUpdates this item to visually indicate that it’s active.
makeDeactiveUpdates this item to visually indicate that it’s not active.
zoomInAllows you to select the tab and zoom in on it, thereby bringing you to the tab in Firefox to interact with.
zoomOutHandles the zoom down animation after returning to TabView.
setZoomPrepEither go into or return from (depending on <value>) “zoom prep” mode, where the tab fills a large portion of the screen in anticipation of the zoom out animation.
TabItemsSingleton for managing TabItems
Functions
initSet up the necessary tracking to maintain the TabItemss.
updateTakes in a xul:tab.
linkTakes in a xul:tab.
unlinkTakes in a xul:tab.
pausePaintingTells TabItems to stop updating thumbnails (so you can do animations without thumbnail paints causing stutters).
resumePaintingUndoes a call to pausePainting.
isPaintingPausedReturns a boolean indicating whether painting is paused or not.
registerAdds the given TabItem to the master list.
unregisterRemoves the given TabItem from the master list.
getItemsReturns a copy of the master array of TabItems.
saveAllSaves all open TabItems.
storageSanityChecks the specified data (as returned by TabItem.getStorageData or loaded from storage) and returns true if it looks valid.
reconnectGiven a TabItem, attempts to load its persistent data from storage.
TabCanvasTakes care of the actual canvas for the tab thumbnail Does not need to be accessed from outside of tabitems.js
Functions
init
paint
toImageData

TabItem

An Item that represents a tab.  Also implements the Subscribable interface.

Parameters

taba xul:tab
Summary
Functions
forceCanvasSizeRepaints the thumbnail with the given resolution, and forces it to stay that resolution until unforceCanvasSize is called.
unforceCanvasSizeStops holding the thumbnail resolution; allows it to shift to the size of thumbnail on screen.
showCachedDataShows the cached data i.e.
hideCachedDataHides the cached data i.e.
getStorageDataGet data to be used for persistent storage of this object.
saveStore persistent for this object.
setBoundsMoves this item to the specified location and size.
getBoundsWithTitleReturns a Rect for the group’s bounds, including the title
inStackReturns true if this item is in a stacked group.
setZSets the z-index for this item.
closeCloses this item (actually closes the tab associated with it, which automatically closes the item.
addClassAdds the specified CSS class to this item’s container DOM element.
removeClassRemoves the specified CSS class from this item’s container DOM element.
setResizableIf value is true, makes this item resizable, otherwise non-resizable.
makeActiveUpdates this item to visually indicate that it’s active.
makeDeactiveUpdates this item to visually indicate that it’s not active.
zoomInAllows you to select the tab and zoom in on it, thereby bringing you to the tab in Firefox to interact with.
zoomOutHandles the zoom down animation after returning to TabView.
setZoomPrepEither go into or return from (depending on <value>) “zoom prep” mode, where the tab fills a large portion of the screen in anticipation of the zoom out animation.

Functions

forceCanvasSize

forceCanvasSize: function(w,
h)

Repaints the thumbnail with the given resolution, and forces it to stay that resolution until unforceCanvasSize is called.

unforceCanvasSize

unforceCanvasSize: function()

Stops holding the thumbnail resolution; allows it to shift to the size of thumbnail on screen.  Note that this call does not nest, unlike TabItems.resumePainting; if you call forceCanvasSize multiple times, you just need a single unforce to clear them all.

showCachedData

showCachedData: function(tabData)

Shows the cached data i.e. image and title.  Note: this method should only be called at browser startup with the cached data avaliable.

hideCachedData

hideCachedData: function()

Hides the cached data i.e. image and title and show the canvas.

getStorageData

getStorageData: function(getImageData)

Get data to be used for persistent storage of this object.

Parameters

getImageDatatrue to include thumbnail pixels (and page title as well); default false

save

save: function(saveImageData)

Store persistent for this object.

Parameters

saveImageDatatrue to include thumbnail pixels (and page title as well); default false

setBounds

setBounds: function(rect,
immediately,
options)

Moves this item to the specified location and size.

Parameters

recta Rect giving the new bounds
immediatelytrue if it should not animate; default false
optionsan object with additional parameters, see below

Possible options

forcetrue to always update the DOM even if the bounds haven’t changed; default false

getBoundsWithTitle

getBoundsWithTitle: function()

Returns a Rect for the group’s bounds, including the title

inStack

inStack: function()

Returns true if this item is in a stacked group.

setZ

setZ: function(value)

Sets the z-index for this item.

close

close: function()

Closes this item (actually closes the tab associated with it, which automatically closes the item.

addClass

addClass: function(className)

Adds the specified CSS class to this item’s container DOM element.

removeClass

removeClass: function(className)

Removes the specified CSS class from this item’s container DOM element.

setResizable

setResizable: function(value)

If value is true, makes this item resizable, otherwise non-resizable.  Shows/hides a visible resize handle as appropriate.

makeActive

makeActive: function()

Updates this item to visually indicate that it’s active.

makeDeactive

makeDeactive: function()

Updates this item to visually indicate that it’s not active.

zoomIn

zoomIn: function()

Allows you to select the tab and zoom in on it, thereby bringing you to the tab in Firefox to interact with.

zoomOut

zoomOut: function(complete)

Handles the zoom down animation after returning to TabView.  It is expected that this routine will be called from the chrome thread (in response to Tabs.onFocus()).

Parameters

completea function to call after the zoom down animation

setZoomPrep

setZoomPrep: function(value)

Either go into or return from (depending on <value>) “zoom prep” mode, where the tab fills a large portion of the screen in anticipation of the zoom out animation.

TabItems

Singleton for managing TabItems

Summary
Functions
initSet up the necessary tracking to maintain the TabItemss.
updateTakes in a xul:tab.
linkTakes in a xul:tab.
unlinkTakes in a xul:tab.
pausePaintingTells TabItems to stop updating thumbnails (so you can do animations without thumbnail paints causing stutters).
resumePaintingUndoes a call to pausePainting.
isPaintingPausedReturns a boolean indicating whether painting is paused or not.
registerAdds the given TabItem to the master list.
unregisterRemoves the given TabItem from the master list.
getItemsReturns a copy of the master array of TabItems.
saveAllSaves all open TabItems.
storageSanityChecks the specified data (as returned by TabItem.getStorageData or loaded from storage) and returns true if it looks valid.
reconnectGiven a TabItem, attempts to load its persistent data from storage.

Functions

init

init: function()

Set up the necessary tracking to maintain the TabItemss.

update

update: function(tab)

Takes in a xul:tab.

link

link: function(tab)

Takes in a xul:tab.

unlink

unlink: function(tab)

Takes in a xul:tab.

pausePainting

pausePainting: function()

Tells TabItems to stop updating thumbnails (so you can do animations without thumbnail paints causing stutters). pausePainting can be called multiple times, but every call to pausePainting needs to be mirrored with a call to resumePainting.

resumePainting

resumePainting: function()

Undoes a call to pausePainting.  For instance, if you called pausePainting three times in a row, you’ll need to call resumePainting three times before TabItems will start updating thumbnails again.

isPaintingPaused

isPaintingPaused: function()

Returns a boolean indicating whether painting is paused or not.

register

register: function(item)

Adds the given TabItem to the master list.

unregister

unregister: function(item)

Removes the given TabItem from the master list.

getItems

getItems: function()

Returns a copy of the master array of TabItems.

saveAll

saveAll: function(saveImageData)

Saves all open TabItems.

Parameters

saveImageDatatrue to include thumbnail pixels (and page title as well); default false

storageSanity

storageSanity: function(data)

Checks the specified data (as returned by TabItem.getStorageData or loaded from storage) and returns true if it looks valid.  TODO: check everything

reconnect

reconnect: function(item)

Given a TabItem, attempts to load its persistent data from storage.

TabCanvas

Takes care of the actual canvas for the tab thumbnail Does not need to be accessed from outside of tabitems.js
